channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The glass left from yahrzeit candles can be another way to memorialize a loved one
item.description: In Jewish tradition, after someone dies, the anniversary of their death is marked by lighting a yahrzeit candle. It comes in a stubby glass holder. In some families, that old glass found a new use.
item.content:encoded: In Jewish tradition, after someone dies, the anniversary of their death is marked by lighting a yahrzeit candle. It comes in a stubby glass holder. In some families, that old glass found a new use.
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Watching Bad Bunny's Super Bowl show in Puerto Rico
item.description: In San Juan, Puerto Rico, we watched the Super Bowl halftime show with the audience Bad Bunny has represented since his start: his fellow Puerto Ricans.
item.content:encoded: In San Juan, Puerto Rico, we watched the Super Bowl halftime show with the audience Bad Bunny has represented since his start: his fellow Puerto Ricans.
item.dc:creator: Isabella Gomez Sarmiento

item.title: Bad Bunny's joyful defiance captivates Super Bowl halftime
item.description: Bad Bunny delivered a joyful 13-minute Super Bowl halftime performance with a message of unity as well as pride in Latin American culture at a time when many Latinos in the U.S. feel under attack.
item.content:encoded: Bad Bunny delivered a joyful 13-minute Super Bowl halftime performance with a message of unity as well as pride in Latin American culture at a time when many Latinos in the U.S. feel under attack.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Ilia Malinin's Olympic backflip made history. But he's not the first to do it
item.description: U.S. figure skating phenom Ilia Malinin did a backflip in his Olympic debut, and another the next day. The controversial move was banned from competition for decades until 2024.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. figure skating phenom Ilia Malinin did a backflip in his Olympic debut, and another the next day. The controversial move was banned from competition for decades until 2024.

(Image credit: Andreas Rentz)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 'Dizzy' author recounts a decade of being marooned by chronic illness
item.description: Rachel Weaver worked for the Forest Service in Alaska where she scaled towering trees to study nature. But in 2006, she woke up and felt like she was being spun in a hurricane. Her memoir is Dizzy.
item.content:encoded: Rachel Weaver worked for the Forest Service in Alaska where she scaled towering trees to study nature. But in 2006, she woke up and felt like she was being spun in a hurricane. Her memoir is Dizzy.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Corrigan

item.title: 'End of Days' recalls the violent 1992 Ruby Ridge confrontation in Idaho
item.description: Author Chris Jennings talks the apocalyptic religious views that fueled the standoff between federal agents and the family of Randy Weaver — and the use of force rules that made it so deadly.
item.content:encoded: Author Chris Jennings talks the apocalyptic religious views that fueled the standoff between federal agents and the family of Randy Weaver — and the use of force rules that made it so deadly.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: Puerto Rico stops for 13 minutes to applaud history and bask in Bad Bunny's glow
item.description: This was Puerto Rico's moment, a spotlight on a collective son who quit bagging groceries a decade ago and became the world's most streamed artist on Spotify last year.
item.content:encoded:
This was Puerto Rico's moment, a spotlight on a collective son who quit bagging groceries a decade ago and became the world's most streamed artist on Spotify last year.

(Image credit: Alejandro Granadillo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A Nashville museum celebrates the role of a small town in American music over the years
item.description: The small town of Muscle Shoals, Alabama has played a great role in American music for decades. Now, a new exhibit in Nashville is honoring its legacy.
item.content:encoded: The small town of Muscle Shoals, Alabama has played a great role in American music for decades. Now, a new exhibit in Nashville is honoring its legacy.
item.dc:creator: Jewly Hight

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: -IUM Pandemonium
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with KPBS listener Anthony Baio and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with KPBS listener Anthony Baio and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for February 7, 2026: With Not My Job guest Mychal Threets
item.description: This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guest Mychal Threets and panelists Tom Bodett, Josh Gondelman, and Tig Notaro
item.content:encoded:
This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guest Mychal Threets and panelists Tom Bodett, Josh Gondelman, and Tig Notaro
